lead_paragraph: The United States Olympian Demetrius Andrade will make his professional debut Oct. 23 at the Northern Quest Casino in eastern Washington. Andrade, 20, from Providence, R.I., was the world champion amateur welterweight in 2007, but lost to South Korea’s Kim Jung-joo in a quarterfinal bout in Beijing last month. He angrily criticized the judging after his loss, echoing the complaints of several fighters on an American team that came home with just one bronze medal. His opponent for the October bout had not yet been selected.
